H0.text: Migration is the animal behavior illustrated by a dog growling when a predator gets close.

H1.text: Hibernation is the animal behavior that a dog exhibits by growling when a predator gets close.

H2.text: Communication is the animal behavior that a dog exhibits when it growls as a predator gets close.

H3.text: Germination is the animal behavior that a dog displays when it growls as a predator gets close.

A4.text: Canines such as wolves and coyotes may adopt an aggressive posture, such as growling with their teeth bared, to indicate they will fight if necessary.

A5.text: One example is the 'play face' in dogs which signals that a subsequent aggressive signal is part of a play fight rather than a serious aggressive episode.
